headline: SoftBank acquiring DigitalBridge for $4B, Lululemon proxy fight
summary: Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including SoftBank's (9984.T, SFTBY) $4 billion acquisition of data center infrastructure firm DigitalBridge Group (DBRG), Intel (INTC) completing its stock sale to stakeholder Nvidia (NVDA), and the Wall Street Journal reporting Lululemon (LULU) founder Chip Wilson is staging a proxy battle by nominating three new board member candidates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Lululemon Founder Chip Wilson Launches Proxy Battle
summary: Lululemon  Athletica‚Äôs founder Chip Wilson is launching a proxy fight at the activewear retailer in a bid to remake the company‚Äôs board of directors.  Wilson has nominated three candidates to Lululemon‚Äôs board: Marc Maurer, former co-CEO of On Running; Laura Gentile, former chief marketing officer at ESPN; and Eric Hirshberg, former CEO of Activision.  The Wall Street Journal earlier reported the news.

headline: Lululemon founder Chip Wilson launches proxy fight for board shakeup
summary:
STORY: Lululemon Athletica founder Chip Wilson is looking to shake up the company's board while the apparel maker searches for a new CEO.

Wilson on Monday said he had launched a proxy fight by nominating three independent board directors.

The move comes just days after Lululemon said CEO Calvin McDonald would step down in January.

In a statement, Wilson said the recent announcement of the CEO departure was, quote, "the third total failure of board oversight, with no clear succession plan in place."

He added that shareholders have, quote, "no faith that this board can select and support the next CEO without input from a board with stronger product experience."

Wilson's board nominees are former On Running co-CEO Marc Maurer, former ESPN Chief Marketing Officer Laura Gentile and former Activision CEO Eric Hirshberg.

Wilson is one of the biggest independent shareholders of Lululemon, with a more than 4% stake, according to LSEG data.

Lululemon shares have shed nearly half their value this year as the company struggles to find its footing with younger and affluent shoppers.

It's also battling stiff competition from newer rivals such as Alo Yoga and Vuori, as well as pressure from activist investor Elliott Management.

Lululemon did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.

content.title: Lululemon founder Chip Wilson launches proxy fight for board shakeup
